text: [Music]
- FEMA and I am back with a new lesson
on the difference between the
expressions still better better still
and better yet well each of these three
expressions are used quite often when we
speak the English language but you have
to be very careful about its usage
because its usage differs with the
context and the meaning when you are
speaking something so let us deal with
the first expression which is still
better alright when do I use the
expression still better I use it when
something was better before and it
continues to be better now okay so for
example you know you have a son and his
and his father who were going out to
play say a basketball game and then his
son the teenage son challenges the
father to a basketball game now the
father can say something like I'm not as
good as I used to be but I'm still
better than you now if you notice I just
said that you used to better when
something was better before so the
father is telling his son that look I
used to be good enough before but I'm
still better than you which means he
continues to still be better in that
particular thing so therefore you use
the expression still better I could say
something like oh I'm not very good with
singing but I'm still better than you
which means I used to be good at it but
I'm still better than most people
in singing or I can also use to better
in another way when I want to say that
something is better even though it has
some bad points let's take an example
the chicken is dry but it is still
better than what I cooked yesterday ok
so we're saying that something out here
is not very good but it is still better
so when we know that something has
certain bad points but we say that look
it's still better than what we did
before so the chicken has got some bad
points it wasn't cooked very well but we
are saying that it is still better than
what was cooked yesterday well that's
how you use the expression still better
we're now going to deal with how we use
the expressions better still and better
yet now that you've understood the
expression still better we will deal
with the expressions better still and
better yet together well why am i
dealing with them together because they
are diametrically opposite in fact they
are the complete opposite of each other
so let's see what each of them means and
in what context we use each of them in
the expression better still is used when
someone makes a good suggestion but you
have an even better one
you have an even better suggestion so
let's look at an example which says you
can send them your resume a which is
your CV or better still try contacting
the hiring manager directly now do you
see what's happening here
there is this person who wants to
obviously get a job and he's trying to
get in touch with his potential
employers so he has an option of sending
his CV or his resume but there is an
even better suggestion which is
contacting the hiring manager directly
and therefore we use the expression
better still to override the suggestion
which was given before which is a pretty
good one but you have an even better
suggestion and therefore you use the
expression better still
now why is better yet the exact opposite
of better still because it is used when
you want to offer a better suggestion to
replace a bad idea okay
so in contrast to better still better
yet is a suggestion which is a better
suggestion to replace not a good idea
not a good suggestion but a bad idea a
bad suggestion so let's look at the
example we have a conversation going on
okay so one of the persons tells his
friend if I am late I will call you and
inform you or if I'm late I will call
you and let you know his friend responds
and says better yet why don't you take
responsibility and leave earlier next
time now
the friend used the word better yet
because he wanted to tell his friend
that look coming late and informing me
is a bad idea but I'm gonna give you a
better suggestion to replace your bad
idea and the better suggestion is to
take responsibility
for yourself and leave earlier next time
so that you don't get late well that's
what you use better yet in you use
better yet when you want to replace a
bad idea
by offering a better suggestion well
that's it from me on this lesson on the
differences between our expressions
still better better still and better yet
well I hope you've understood this
lesson but now it is time to take a test
to find out how much you've learnt so
please go on to the link in the
description below this video to find out
how much you've really understood well
that's it from me in from this lesson on
still better better still and better yet
I'll be back with some more until then
this is me saying goodbye
you
